bill_title: revise the definition of a temporary supplemental lot.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the definition of a temporary supplemental lot. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That subdivision (17) of § 32-6B-1 be amended to read as follows: (17) "Temporary supplemental lot," a location other than the principal place of business or supplemental lot but within the same county as the principal place of business , or in an adjoining county, if the adjoining county has no licensed vehicle dealer selling automobiles, pick-ups, or passenger vans and the temporary supplemental lot is no more than twenty-five miles from the principal place of business, where a licensed vehicle dealer or a licensed used vehicle dealer may conduct business for a period of time not to exceed ten consecutive days for a specific purpose such as fairs, auto shows, auctions, shopping center promotions , or tent sales. A temporary supplemental lot shall meet all local zoning and building codes for the type of business being conducted; 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the definition of a temporary supplemental lot. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That subdivision (17) of § 32-6B-1 be amended to read as follows: (17) "Temporary supplemental lot," a location other than the principal place of business or supplemental lot but within the same county as the principal place of business , or in an adjoining county, if the adjoining county has no licensed vehicle dealer selling automobiles, pick-ups, or passenger vans and the temporary supplemental lot is no more than ten miles from the principal place of business, where a licensed vehicle dealer or a licensed used vehicle dealer may conduct business for a period of time not to exceed ten consecutive days for a specific purpose such as fairs, auto shows, auctions, shopping center promotions , or tent sales. A temporary supplemental lot shall meet all local zoning and building codes for the type of business being conducted; BILL HISTORY 1/27/99 First read in House and referred to Transportation. H.J. 211 2/3/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/3/99 Transportation Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 13, NAYS 0. H.J. 345

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the definition of a temporary supplemental lot. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That subdivision (17) of § 32-6B-1 be amended to read as follows: (17) "Temporary supplemental lot," a location other than the principal place of business or supplemental lot but within the same county as the principal place of business , or in an adjoining county, if the adjoining county has no licensed vehicle dealer selling automobiles, pick-ups, or passenger vans and the temporary supplemental lot is no more than ten miles from the principal place of business, where a licensed vehicle dealer or a licensed used vehicle dealer may conduct business for a period of time not to exceed ten consecutive days for a specific purpose such as fairs, auto shows, auctions, shopping center promotions , or tent sales. A temporary supplemental lot shall meet all local zoning and building codes for the type of business being conducted . If a licensed vehicle dealer establishes a temporary supplemental lot in a county with a licensed used vehicle dealer, a licensed used vehicle dealer may establish a temporary supplemental lot in a county with a licensed vehicle dealer ; BILL HISTORY 1/27/99 First read in House and referred to Transportation. H.J. 211 2/3/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/3/99 Transportation Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 13, NAYS 0. H.J. 345 2/5/99 House of Representatives Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 58, NAYS 5. H.J. 404 2/8/99 First read in Senate and referred to Transportation. S.J. 382 2/11/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/16/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/16/99 Transportation Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 7, NAYS 0. S.J. 494 2/16/99 Transportation Place on Consent Calendar.
